etymology.description: 皿(皿) (mǐn, "dish") + phonetic 威(威) (wēi) = resembling dish for the head -> helmet
etymology.interpretation: The character 盔(盔) (kuī, "helmet") combines 皿(皿) (mǐn, "dish") as the semantic element, suggesting the shape or function of a helmet covering the head like a dish. The phonetic 威(威) (wēi) contributes the sound, creating an association with protection or a covering, like a helmet.

examples.chinese: 骑士戴上盔(騎士戴上盔)，奋勇冲锋(奮勇衝鋒)。
examples.english: The knight put on his helmet and charged valiantly.

examples.chinese: 古代战士佩戴盔(古代戰士佩戴盔)，抵御敌人(抵禦敵人)。
examples.english: Ancient warriors wore helmets to fend off enemies.
